author: Alexander Bolton
description: Sen. Jon Ossoff (Ga.), the most vulnerable Democratic incumbent in the Senate, and his home-state colleague, Sen. Raphael Warnock (D-Ga.), voted Thursday for a Republican bill to pay essential federal workers, including members of the military, during the government shutdown. Ossoff and Warnock joined Sen. John Fetterman (D-Pa.) in voting for the Republican bill. The…
title: Ossoff, Warnock break with Democrats on bill to pay essential workers during shutdown

author: The Hill Staff
description: President Trump had the East Wing of the White House demolished this week, a change of course from previous statements that his massive, privately funded ballroom addition would be near but not touch the structure. Starting Monday, construction equipment broke the facade of the portion of the White House complex that was home to offices…
title: See photos of the White House’s demolished East Wing

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Sen. Ron Johnson (R-Wis.) objected to a request by Sen. Chris Van Hollen (D-Md.) on Thursday for the Senate to immediately consider and pass a bill to pay all federal workers, members of the military and federal contractors during the 2025 government shutdown. The True Shutdown Fairness Act would also prevent the Trump administration from…
title: GOP senator blocks Democratic bill to pay all federal employees during shutdown

author: Rachel Van Gilder
description: A state panel says it considers a proposal to build an electric vehicle plant near Big Rapids "abandoned," so it is clawing back some $175 million in incentives for the project.
title: Michigan yanks incentives for controversial EV battery plant

author: Lyndon Haviland, opinion contributor
description: Experts who truly care about the health of our nation are being overrun by those with political aspirations.
title: US health policy must be guided by science, not ideology

author: Julia Shapero
description: President Trump has pardoned Changpeng Zhao, the founder of cryptocurrency exchange Binance, the White House said Thursday.  Zhao, who previously served as CEO of Binance, pleaded guilty to charges in 2023 for violating anti-money laundering laws. He was sentenced to four months in prison.  “President Trump exercised his constitutional authority by issuing a pardon for…
title: Trump pardons Binance founder Changpeng Zhao in bid to end ‘war on crypto’

author: Emily Brooks
description: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy on Thursday warned of possible flight delays and cancellations during the government shutdown, saying the federal safety system depends on air traffic controllers going in to work even without pay. “I can’t guarantee you that your flight’s going to be on time. I can’t guarantee that your flight’s not gonna be…
title: Transportation Secretary Duffy ‘can’t guarantee’ on-time flights during shutdown

author: Julia Manchester
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams confirmed in an interview with The New York Times that he will endorse former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo (I) in the race to replace him ahead of Election Day.  Adams is slated to endorse Cuomo on Thursday, a day after the two were spotted seated next to each…
title: Adams says he will endorse Cuomo

author: Julia Manchester
description: Sen. John Cornyn (R-Texas) launched his first significant attack against his latest primary challenger Rep. Wesley Hunt (R-Texas) on Thursday, referring to his fellow Lone Star State lawmaker as “fake MAGA.”  The incumbent senator made the attacks in a new microsite and digital ad, backed by a five-figure investment. “Wesley Hunt says he’s MAGA but the…
title: Cornyn calls Hunt ‘fake MAGA’ in new ad

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Former Rep. George Santos (R-N.Y.) committed to repaying his fraud victims on Wednesday, days after President Trump commuted his sentence and the former lawmaker walked free from prison. In an interview on NewsNation’s “Cuomo,” the New York Republican said his legal team is “looking into” ways to pay restitution, even though his clemency order frees…
title: Santos ‘looking into’ repaying fraud victims

author: Brahma Chellaney, opinion contributor
description: The Oslo-based Nobel Peace Prize committee may have turned down President Trump’s latest bid for glory. Yet by honoring Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado — at a time when Trump is openly backing efforts to topple the government in Caracas — it has laid bare the extent to which the peace prize has become…
title: From peace to power: How the Nobel Peace Prize turned political
